X01_state.note: State directory is the single largest cross-boundary target. Nearly every component writes or reads from it.

X03_scripts_core.note: Core Python modules executed for calculations and state management.

X04_data_materials.note: Material JSON databases loaded at startup and cached.

X05_extracted_machines.note: Machine data loaded and cached by MachineRegistry.

X06_extracted_tools.note: Tool data loaded and cached by ToolRegistry.

X08_skills_consolidated.note: 230+ skills loaded dynamically. Major data dependency.

X10_autonomous_tasks.note: ATCS task storage for autonomous operations.

X11_data_coordination.note: Agent coordination JSON loaded by dataLoader.

X13_extracted_knowledge_bases.note: Knowledge base files for query engine.

risk_assessment.critical: X01 (state) has 35 inbound edges - any state dir restructuring breaks ~35 modules
risk_assessment.high: X08 (skills-consolidated) has 6 consumers loading 230+ skill files dynamically
risk_assessment.medium: X03 (scripts/core) has 7 consumers executing Python - Python path changes break calculations
risk_assessment.low: X04-X07 (data dirs) are well-cached through registries, lower blast radius

3 separate path constants hardcoded instead of using PATHS

circular_dependencies.description: HookEngine and hookRegistration import from each other via barrel exports. HookEngine defines the engine class, hookRegistration registers hooks into it, but both files have import statements referencing each other.
circular_dependencies.fix_strategy: Extract shared types/interfaces into a separate hooks/types.ts file. HookEngine should not import hookRegistration directly; instead, hookRegistration should call HookEngine.register() at startup.

circular_dependencies.description: EventBus emits events that HookEngine listens to, but HookEngine also triggers EventBus emissions. Tightly coupled event-hook system.
circular_dependencies.fix_strategy: Make EventBus a pure pub/sub with no knowledge of HookEngine. HookEngine subscribes to EventBus events at registration time only. Remove any direct imports of HookEngine from EventBus.

circular_dependencies.description: autoHookWrapper invokes cadence functions which use TelemetryEngine, which indirectly triggers autoHookWrapper via event listeners. Indirect circular dependency through the event system.
circular_dependencies.fix_strategy: Break the cycle by making TelemetryEngine fire-and-forget for hook events. autoHookWrapper should not be re-entrant - add a guard flag to prevent recursive invocation.

orphan_modules.description: Unused newer version of autoHookWrapper. Not imported by any file.
orphan_modules.recommendation: Review if this was intended as a replacement for autoHookWrapper.ts. Either complete the migration or delete.

orphan_modules.description: Backup/recovered copy of autoHookWrapper. Not imported by any file.
orphan_modules.recommendation: Delete after confirming autoHookWrapper.ts is the canonical version.

orphan_modules.description: Archived tool files still present in src/ directory. None are imported by active code.
orphan_modules.recommendation: Move entire _archived/ directory outside of src/ to prevent accidental imports and reduce build scope. Consider moving to a top-level archive/ directory.

orphan_modules.description: Archived registry copies still present in registries/ directory. None are imported by active code.
orphan_modules.recommendation: Move outside of src/ to prevent confusion with active registries.

orphan_modules.description: Legacy hook engine that may be replaced by engines/HookEngine.ts (E22 HookExecutor). Both files exist and have overlapping functionality.
orphan_modules.recommendation: Audit all imports to determine which HookEngine is actually in use. If orchestration/HookEngine.ts is fully replaced by engines/HookExecutor.ts, archive it. Currently I06 (hookRegistration.ts) still references it, creating the CIRC01 circular dependency.
